mcm.graphics
Class Drawable

java.lang.Object
  mcm.graphics.Drawable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Stage
public class Drawable
extends java.lang.Object

A Drawable provides a double buffered drawing area.

A drawable is associated with a Component. It provides a coordinate system with the origin (0,0) at its lower left corner. The coordinates of its upper right corner are (width-1 , height-1).

Author:
Monika Mevenkamp

Constructor Detail

Drawable

public Drawable(java.awt.Component c)
Constructs a new Drawable object for the given Component. The drawable provides a double buffer (image and assciated graphics context) that can be used to draw to. The graphics context is defined such that (0, 0) is at the lower left of the image.

Parameters:
c - the component to draw to

public boolean resize()
Resizes this drawable according to the dimension's of its associated Component.

isInside

public boolean isInside(double x,
                        double y)
Determines whether the given point (x,y) lies within this drawable's boundaries. A point inside the drawable must have an x coordinate greater or equal zero and smaller than the drawable's current width. Its y coordinate must be greater equal zero and smaller than the drawable's current height.

Returns:
true if pt lies within this drawable's boundaries; false otherwise

isInside

public boolean isInside(Point pt)
The same as isInsize(pt.x, pt.y)

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Paints the contents of the double buffer to the given graphics context.

Parameters:
g - the graphics context to which the double buffer is drawn

public void setColor(java.awt.Color c)
Sets the drawable's background color.

Parameters:
c - the new background color

draw

public void draw(Drawable image,
                 int x,
                 int y)
Copy the given drawable onto this drawable. The given drawable is drawn such that its lower left corner appears at (x,y).

Parameters:
image -
x -
y -

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                 int x,
                 int y)
Copy this drawable's double buffer to the given graphics context. Draw it so that the double buffer is positioned at (x,y).

Parameters:
g - the graphics copntect to draw to
x - x coordinate of lower left corner
y - y coordinate of lower left corner

getPixelColor

public java.awt.Color getPixelColor(int x,
                                    int y)
Get RGB color of given pixel location in double buffer

Parameters:

y - pixel's y coordinate
Returns:
pixel's rgb color

write

public void write(java.lang.String format,
                  java.lang.String file)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes this drawable's contents to the given file in the given format. Uses ImageIO.write(java.awt.image.RenderedImage, java.lang.String, java.io.File) to do so.

Parameters:
format - image file's format
file - name of output file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs in writing
